sitename.label: Name
sitename.helper: A short name for your weather station. This will be used in headings and reports etc

description.label: Description
description.helper: A longer description of your weather station. This will be used to add additional information to the web pages

latitude.label: Latitude
latitude.helper: Enter your latitude as a decimal value (+ve = North, -ve = South).

longitude.label: Longitude
longitude.helper: Enter your longitude as a decimal value (+ve = East, -ve = West).

altitude.label: Altitude
altitude.helper: Enter the elevation of your weather station above sea level. This is used for pressure calculations so get it as accurate as you can

units.helper: Think carefully, you cannot change these later and retain any existing data

stationtype.label: Station type
optionLabels: Fine Offset with Solar Sensors (and clones)

stationmodel.label: Station model
stationmodel.helper: A descriptive name for your station type, this will default to the station type if blank. You can change this to whatever you like

comportname.label: Serial port name
comportname.helper: Your station serial port (real or virtual)

disconperiod.label: Disconnect period
disconperiod.helper: Period to disconnect once a minute from IP loggers to allow them to upload to WeatherLink.com. Time in seconds

autoDiscover.label: Auto-Discovery
autoDiscover.helper: Enable auto-discovery of your WLL devices IP address - do not enable if you have more than one device

ipaddress.label: IP address
helpers: Enter the IP address of your device if not using auto-discovery
This will be populated for you if auto-discovery is successful
You can configure extra sensors in the main Station Settings page after completing this wizard

wind.label: Wind sensor Transmitter ID:
wind.helper: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Wind sensor

temphum.label: Temperature/Humidity Transmitter ID:
temphum.helper: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Temperature/Humidity sensor

rain.label: Rain sensor Transmitter ID:
rain.helper: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Rain sensor

solar.label: Solar sensor Transmitter ID:
solar.helper: Optional: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Solar sensor

uv.label: UV sensor Transmitter ID:
uv.helper: Optional: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your UV sensor

apiKey.label: WeatherLink APIv2 key
helpers: Enter your WeatherLink.com APIv2 key
Leave this blank if you do not have a WeatherLink.com Pro/Pro+ subscription

apiSecret.label: WeatherLink APIv2 secret
helpers: Enter your WeatherLink.com APIv2 secret
Leave this blank if you do not have a WeatherLink.com Pro/Pro+ subscription

apiStationId.label: WLL device id on WeatherLink
helpers: Enter the station id used for your WLL device in the WeatherLink.com APIv2, OR if you do not know this, leave this field blank and Cumulus will attempt to discover it for you
Leave this at default -1 if you do not have a WeatherLink.com Pro/Pro+ subscription

autoDiscover.label: Auto-Discovery
autoDiscover.helper: Enable auto-discovery of your GW-1000 devices IP address - do not enable if you have more than one device

ipaddress.label: IP address
helpers: Enter the IP address of your device if not using auto-discovery
This will be populated for you if auto-discovery is successful

macaddress.label: MAC address (read the help below!)
helpers: Populated by Cumulus when using auto-discovery.
Do not edit unless you change your GW-1000 device for a new one, then just delete this entry and the new MAC address will be added for you by auto-discovery.

syncreads.label: Synchronise
syncreads.helper: Attempts to synchronise console reads to avoid clashing with the console writing the data

readavoid.label: Read Avoid Period
helpers: The time span around the synchronised read to avoid reading from the console.
The default 3 seconds means do not read from  3 secs before to 3 secs after the expected write time.
Time in seconds

interval.label: File Read Interval
helpers: How often to read the EasyWeather data file in minutes

filename.label: Filename
helpers: Path and filename of the EasyWeather data file (Easyweather.dat or EasyWeatherPlus.dat)

comportname.label: Serial port name
comportname.helper: Enter the serial port name via a serial port (real or virtual)

baudrate.label: Serial Baud Rate
baudrate.helper: Serial port baud rate in bps

comportname.label: Serial port name
comportname.helper: Enter the serial port name via a serial port (real or virtual)

loginterval.label: Log interval
loginterval.helper: Frequency of Cumulus log entries - set your station to the same

localcopy.label: Local Copy
localcopy.rightLabel: Enable local file copy of standard files
helpers: Rather than using FTP simply copy the standard web files to another folder.
Typically this would be used when 'self hosting', when FTP would not be appropriate/efficient.
It can be used in conjunction with FTP.

localcopyfolder.label: Local copy destination folder path
helpers: Enter the folder name to which you wish to copy the standard files
Note: The path entered here should end with a folder separator - Windows = \, Linux = /
localcopyfolder.placeholder: Destination path with trailing folder delimiter

enabled.label: FTP
helpers: Enable web site uploads via FTP, FTPS, or SFTP

hostname.label: Host name
hostname.helper: Enter the host name of the remote FTP server. Leaving this blank also suppresses all FTP activities.

sslftp.label: Select the FTP Protocol to use
sslftp.helper: Select the protocol required by your web host

ftpport.label: FTP port
ftpport.helper: Enter the FTP port to use. Common defaults are: FTP=21, FTPS=990, SFTP=22

sshAuth.label: SFTP Authentication method
sshAuth.helper: Select the authentication method for SFTP connections

pskFile.label: Pre-shared Private Key file for SFTP
pskFile.helper: Filename for your private PSK file, include the full path if the file is not in your CumulusMX folder

enabled.label: Enable
helpers: Enable the update interval timer so normal interval actions can take place

enableintervalftp.label: FTP
enableintervalftp.helper: Select this to have Cumulus upload FTP files at the normal update interval

ftpinterval.label: Normal interval
ftpinterval.helper: Interval between normal updates in minutes

enabled.label: Enable
enabled.helper: Start the real time timer so that any real time actions can take place

enablerealtimeftp.label: FTP
enablerealtimeftp.helper: Establish the real time FTP connection so that FTP uploads can take place at the real time interval

realtimeinterval.label: Real time interval
realtimeinterval.helper: Interval between real time updates in seconds
